title: Rotational Kinetic Energy
text: To calculate the Earth's rotational kinetic energy, we use the formula for rotational kinetic $$energy:KE=\frac{1}{2} I {\omega}^2$$.

title: Moment of Inertia of the Earth in Orbit
text: For orbital motion, we treat the Earth as a point mass at a distance $$r$$ from the Sun. The moment of inertia $$I=m r^2$$.

title: Find the Angular Velocity in $$\frac{rad}{s}$$
text: The Earth completes one revolution around the Sun in approximately one year $$(365.25$$ $$days=31557600$$ second). Use the same formula for the angular velocity ω=2pi​/T.

title: Plug in the Values
text: Just as what we did for the last question, calculate I and ω following the previous two hints and then solve for KE.
